Package ch.danielhoop.sql

Class SQLToolbox

  • java.lang.Object
    • ch.danielhoop.sql.SQLToolbox
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.AutoCloseable
    public class SQLToolbox
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.AutoCloseable
    Decorator/wrapper class for data base basics.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructor for the case that the jdbc driver (jar) is *not* included in the project.

    • Method Detail

      • main

        public static void main​(java.lang.String[] args)
        The main function can be used from the command line to read a SQL file, and direct the output from the query (a 2 dimensional table) to a specified file. The command line arguments must look like: --driverPath "driverPath" --driverName "driverClassName" --address "databaseAddress" --user "user" --password "password" --inputFile "inputSQLFile" --outputFile "outputDataFile" --columnSeparator "columnSeparatorForOutputFile" --nullValue "0" Optional arguments are: --replaceRegex "anyRegexStringWillOnlyWorkForStingAndDateColumns" --deleteFile
        Parameters:
        args -

      • readSqlAndSaveData

        public void readSqlAndSaveData​(java.lang.String sqlFileName,
                               java.lang.String dataFileName,
                               java.lang.String columnSeparator,
                               java.lang.String fillNullValuesWith,
                               java.lang.String replaceRegex,
                               java.lang.String insertInsteadOfRegex,
                               boolean writeToConsoleOnlyNoFile)
                        throws java.sql.SQLException,
                               java.io.FileNotFoundException,
                               java.io.UnsupportedEncodingException,
                               java.io.IOException
        Method to read SQL query from a txt file and save the result to a csv file.
        Parameters:
        infoText - An information text that is printed to the console when the method is executed.
        sqlFileName - The relative/absolute path where the txt file containing the SQL query is located.
        dataFileName - The relative/absolute path where the file with the resulting data should be saved.
        columnSeparator - The String to separate colums in the data file.
        fillNullValuesWith - The String to replace null values. Can also be "null". But not null!
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException
        java.io.FileNotFoundException
        java.io.UnsupportedEncodingException
        java.io.IOException
